Author: JanuaryN
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Global Macro Trends - Economic Analysis  “2018 has brought us a new more dynamic and multifaceted economic arena, now is the time for regional convictions and an active approach to long and short alpha across global markets.” Sharpe’s Market Analyst, Max Thornton, has published an incredibly interesting Global Macro Trends report which discusses countries long and short opportunities based on debt, unemployment rate and investment. This economic analysis document is accompanied by a colour coded map, the map aims to illustrate which countries, in terms of investment, are a ‘no go’, should be looked at with ‘caution’, ‘proceed’ and those that are a ‘standout’.  You can view the in-depth document and map here: https://bit.ly/2rNK0pm

Author: mexi.db
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: The December service fee payment has now been processed.  Each Centuri user has now received their share of this months $10 000 service fee payment.  *Note: A high reputation score, increasing your SHP stake and lots of correct predictions, will maximise your share of the monthly service fee payment.  Some statistics from this months service fee payment:  - A maximum of $1.85 per correct prediction was paid out this month - Average of $0.06 per correct prediction was paid out this month - The accuracy of the top five users was between 50-74% who made between 441-1867 predictions. $0.05 was on average the amount received per correct prediction. - 17 users earned more than the average payment per user of $74 this month

Author: JanuaryN
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Last month the team held an AMA to answer your questions:  1) What will be your estimated main income stream in the next year(s)? The passive income from the fund? The revenues from selling your data? HFT? All three? Or even other things? We anticipate the majority of our revenue to come from algorithmic trading strategies in the short term, shifting to a focus on alternative data products early next year.  2) Can you share your plans regarding other products you are developing? HFT, Global Sentiment Index are a sure thing I assume. But what can we look out for next? Is the arbitrage bot and trustless ledger still planned? This is detailed in our updated roadmap, which will be released with the new website soon. Our HFT algorithms are already in operation, and constantly being monitored and improved. You can expect some more detailed updates on this topic over the next 2–4 weeks.  Read more at https://medium.com/sharpe/sharpe-ama-sept-2018-9012c78891e2

Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Which brand is of interest to you? Capital — Those interested in trading a variety of different asset classes, across both cryptocurrency markets and equities  Ventures — Young companies with a great team and growth plan, investing in and focussing on the adoption blockchain technology  Analytics — Financial institutions or individuals interested in real time predictive analytics, and how sentiment data can benefit and inform investment decisions.  Learn more about Sharpe's structure at https://medium.com/sharpe/sharpe-introducing-our-new-look-b6c21673c528  and share your thoughts with us at https://t.me/sharpecapital

Author: mexi.db
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: The last September snapshot and payout introduced a new schedule and some terminologies you'll be interested in as a Centuri user:  Terminology recap: SHP stake averaging: The average staking takes a time-weighted average of SHP held throughout the snapshot period, for all wallets linked to the Centuri account.  Snapshot, a summary of the Centuri prediction data between two dates. The snapshot details the overall performance (repuation scores, correct predictions) and the total amount to be paid out per user.  Read more at: https://medium.com/sharpe/september-snapshot-and-important-update-ac79e3cd17e5

Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Sharpe's SCD token sale is on the roadmap for March, 2019!  SCD will be issued via a separate crowdsale for a dedicated tokenised fund. Author: JanuaryN
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: From Page 3 of the whitepaper:  Our longer term goal, therefore, is to develop the Sharpe Crypto-Derivative (SCD) token, subject to necessary approvals. This first-inclass token creates the foundations for a solid link between blockchain assets and the global economy, and will ultimately provide possible payment of dividends to participants. Through our community governance structure, in which SHP holders have the right to table and vote on motions which guide the direction of Sharpe Capital, we ultimately aim to deliver a suite of investment products with various risk profiles and across multiple asset classes, including blockchain assets. The timeline for SCD issuance is Q1 2019. An independent crowd-sale will be held for the issuance of SCD tokens, from which 100% of the proceeds will be directly invested using our proprietary trading technology.

Body: I don't know where do you see stability in prices of SHP as it has lost approximately more than half of its value as well. When I bought it was at around $0.25 per token. Price will rise I am sure but now it was purpose correct the fact only.

Author: Mr.Ease
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Yeah it has lost value, but comparing to other tokens in the market, a 50% loss (as bad as that sounds) is actually pretty decent. Look at Eth - its down 80% from recent highs. Bitcoin is down 60%+ I have other projects that are 1/30th Ico   Anyways, to me it seems SHP has some stronger hands, and this situation makes me think of investing into a larger bag...

Author: filsid
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Sharpe has released another Centuri feature! Up until now, users were only shown this month’s data on their reputation score chart, but the chart has just got a whole lot more detailed, with the added capability to filter a reputation score by time period. Users are able to watch their reputation score evolve over time.  We have added a one month, three month, six month and one year filter, giving the user the opportunity to track and improve their reputation score and review their reputation score strategies.  It is as easy as the image below. To view your reputation score data during different time periods; select your reputation score and choose the time period you would like to review. https://medium.com/sharpe/sharpe-has-released-another-centuri-feature-9f478b548551

Author: Tarasov1992
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: A post from Lewis:  Hey everyone, I just received some interesting questions about some of our progress and future plans from a member of our community, which gave me an idea to respond via blog post in AMA format.  If anybody would like to submit any questions please post them here: https://t.me/sharpecapital and tag with #AMA and we'll add them to the list.  I'll probably get to responding sometime over the weekend and publish next week. Thanks!

Author: JanuaryN
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: We've collected over 1.5 million predictions from 500 active users since our platform launch  Choose your favourite stocks and share the best predictions you can to maximise your payment each month  Reputation scores Your reputation score is a measure of how good you are at predicting future asset prices. Each user has a reputation score between 0 and 100, starting at 50 when they first using the platform. This score increases with every correct prediction and decreases with each incorrect prediction. Monthly payments will be higher for users with higher reputation scores, incentivising the best honest use of the platform and ensuring we collect the highest quality predictions.  Acquire a minimum of one SHP to provide sentiment and earn your fee!  https://sharpe.capital/centuri

Author: DashingCrypto
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Phenomenal article. A great quote:  Quote Much of the ‘value’ that has been created with recent ICOs can be attributed to wash-trading. We simply do not believe the volume figures quoted by exchanges for some of these new projects, with hundreds of thousands to millions of dollars of daily volume on relatively obscure trading platforms. This is evidenced, to an extent, by the existence of so-called ‘market makers’ charging six figures each month to increase volumes. Sharpe operates its own market-making algorithm on Qryptos, which can be clearly seen by looking at the beautifully linear depth in the order-book. This, however, does not translate into large volume because the majority of SHP is held and utilised for its intended purpose.  So good!

Author: caisa88
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: I'm really impressed that the team mananged to give a pay out of 30.000$ in such bad market conditions. To be honest i really don't understand why the price of 1 SHP got so low( it's only 0.11$ right now on Bancor). Maybe the people didn't like the idea that they will receive the bigger dividends only once per quarter.

Author: EyeofthebeHODLer
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Thanks for the support caisa88! It is hard to say exactly what caused that decrease, given Sharpe's continued success with the Centuri Platform. However it is likely been affected in part by the unfavorable market conditions and the fact that the team is not focused on marketing and outreach right now. Instead they have mainly been focused on the actual development to this point.

Author: TOM47
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: SHP — Listing on Qryptos Exchange https://medium.com/sharpecapital/shp-listing-on-qryptos-e274fba557b5  We’re pleased to announce that SHP will be listing on QRYPTOS on Wednesday, 20th June. After spending the past six months developing the Sharpe Centuri platform, expanding our team, and continuing to deliver value to our dedicated community of users, we are delighted to be partnering with Qryptos to provide increased exposure and liquidity to SHP.  As discussed in one of our previous posts, we always wanted to take great care when choosing where to list our tokens to ensure we delivered a high quality exchange for our community and token holders. After speaking with the team behind Qryptos, Quoine, and hearing about their plans, we were particularly impressed with a number of the aspects of their business and operation.  Qryptos are one of a handful of exchanges to meet our stringent requirements of security, regulatory compliance, and user experience. We were particularly impressed with the approach Qryptos takes in securing user funds, utilising cold-storage BTC multi-sig wallets coupled with dedicated private servers, effectively mitigating security concerns that plague many other exchanges. We are also satisfied that that the order matching engine and user analytics provided are best-in-class, providing a highly streamlined user experience during trading. The company behind Qryptos, Quione, is the first global FinTech company to be fully-licensed by the Japanese Financial Services Agency (JFSA).

Author: JanuaryN
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: How much do you know about providing sentiment at Sharpe Capital?  Reputation scores  Your reputation score is a measure of how good you are at predicting future asset prices. Each user has a reputation score between 0 and 100, starting at 50 when they first using the platform. This score increases with every correct prediction and decreases with each incorrect prediction. Monthly Ether payments will be higher for users with higher reputation scores, incentivising the best honest use of the platform and ensuring we collect high quality predictions from users.

Author: TraditionalScience
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Sentiment crowdsourcing platform  The crowd-sourced sentiment platform (described in Section 6) and reputation scoring that feeds into our investment modeling, and provides service fees to SHP holders in exchange for accurate sentiment indications, is implemented and maintained through a smart contract on the Ethereum blockchain as well. This creates an immutable track record of the sentiment provided by a speciﬁc SHP holder, such that reputation scores cannot be manipulated to ‘trick’ our reward-system into paying the excess or undue service fees, nor is it possible for service fees due to not be paid - this too is enforced by the smart contract. As with the TLS, we are building a web-based platform and mobile app for the sentiment analysis & reputation scoring platform.   To know more, Read through our WP @ https://sharpe.capital/whitepaper.pdf

Author: mexi.db
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: They are separate. SCD will be issued via a separate crowdsale for a dedicated tokenized fund. SHP tokens are used to access and participate in the sentiment platform. There is no fundraising component to SCD. All investment in that will be deployed in a combination crypto and equities fund. All major decisions governing that fund will be made by SHP holders through our community governance structures.

Author: JanuaryN
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: The stock market is fundamentally driven by two forces.  The first is quan- titative, dictated by the efficient market hypothesis, that an asset’s trading market value is intrinsically linked to the microeconomic performance of the asset. The logic behind this driving force is so simple as to be almost trivial – that the collective action of every trader taking a position in an asset will encapsulate  all  information  about  that  asset,  thus  driving  it  to  an  equilib- rium reflecting its true value.  However, traders do not take positions based on  their  belief  of  an  asset’s  price.  Traders  do  not  take  positions  based  on their belief of an asset’s future price, either.  Traders take positions based on their perception of what other traders believe about an asset’s future perfor- mance.  This nuance leads to the second force responsible for determining price action in stocks: participant sentiment.  Read more: https://sharpe.capital/whitepaper.pdf

Author: sugarlady43
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: We aren’t crowdsourcing forecasts or analysis of any kind, and do not pay prizes. We’re measuring market sentiment and paying our community members in ETH, in proportion to their contribution. We’re combining sentiment data with our own machine learning-driven investment strategies (and publicly recording our positions at Sharpe.fund), generating profit for community members while we develop blockchain asset analysis tools based on these strategies to assist institutional investors in understanding market movements in real-time. API tools are in development and more information will be released later.

Author: JanuaryN
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: As introduced in Section 1, the investment strategy utilised by the model is underpinned by the notion that asset prices are driven by two forces. The first of these is the tendency for asset prices to move towards their ‘intrinsic’ value  through  the  equilibria  achieved  from  supply-demand  curves,  based on the collective opinions of very many traders or participants that, by and large,  have  access  to  the  same  microeconomic  data  relating  to  each  asset. This  market  force  is  essentially  that  described  by  the  Efficient  Market  Hy- pothesis [16], however, the efficient market hypothesis is not the whole story [17]: it fails to take participant sentiment, emotional responses, and decision theory, into account...  https://sharpe.capital/whitepaper.pdf

Author: JanuaryN
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: We are pleased to announce that our fourth service fee payment and prize draw has been successfully completed as of 13th April 2018. It has been an admittedly challenging quarter, with both the cryptocurrency market and US stocks in significant decline. Despite this, we are pleased to be in a position to provide our Sentiment Providers with $17,000 USD (equivalent), plus 10,000 SHP.  Read More https://medium.com/sharpecapital/april-service-fee-payments-month-4-c87a3df780ab

Author: JanuaryN
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: We did quite well in January by accurately forecasting a major correction and recovery ahead of time. From this, we created a modest reserve pool from which we could draw service fees without having to close positions unprofitably. We also hold positions in US equities (not just crypto), this also helped us to stay Sharpe in these turbulent market conditions. Oh, and we can also short crypto using CFDs.  Note: Service fee payments are, as described in the white paper, entirely discretionary, and not a fixed function of profit.  This, and more gems available at https://t.me/sharpecapital

Author: JanuaryN
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: From the Telegram channel:  "Example use case for ETHLend, someone wishes to provide 10,000 XYZ tokens as collateral for a 10 ETH loan. 10,000 XYZ may be worth 10 ETH at the time the loan is taken out, but if realtime sentiment towards the asset is very negative, then the price could fall dramatically causing the person taking the loan to default, leaving the loan provider bagholding worthless XYZ tokens.  By visualising sentiment towards the asset over different time horizons, loan makers can gain further insight into risk. I think this is an incredibly valuable use-case for our data." - James Butler, Co-founder & COO  For related in-depth conversation, join us at https://t.me/sharpecapital

Author: JanuaryN
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: We are pleased to announced that our third service fee payment has now been issued to our dedicated community of Sharpe Sentiment Providers, as of 16th March 2018.  We have distributed a total of $65,000 USD (equivalent) in Ether, at a rate of $610 USD per ETH. Users who provided 500 or more correct predictions of price movement received an average of 1.2 cents per SHP held as proof-of-stake. On Saturday 17th March, we will distribute 10,000 SHP tokens to our users as described in this update.  Read more at https://medium.com/sharpecapital/march-service-fee-payments-month-3-d9b9d7cb5079

Author: JanuaryN
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Collecting the highest quality market sentiment data possible is a top priority for Sharpe, and we are always on the lookout for new ways in which we can reward our dedicated users. That’s why today, we are announcing a monthly prize draw giveaway totalling 10,000 SHP.  The lucky recipients will be determined on the 10th of each month, along with the ETH service fee payment amounts. Each user will be allocated a ‘ticket’ for the draw for each correct prediction they have made in that month. Therefore, any user with just one correct prediction in a month can win, but doubling the number of correct predictions you have will double your chances to win!  The prizes for March are as follows:  1st Prize — 5,000 SHP 2nd Prize — 3,000 SHP 3rd Prize — 1,000 SHP 4th Prize — 500 SHP 5th Prize — 500 SHP  Read more at: https://medium.com/sharpecapital/introducing-the-10-000-shp-monthly-prize-draw-e17269d648b3

Author: JanuaryN
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: How it works  We're using a range of different modelling techniques to analyse market opportunities, quantitative data and predictions from "The Crowd".  Artificial Neural Network- Artificial Neural Networks allow us to create self-learning models, which are capable of looking for predictive patterns in financial data.  Neural Language Processing- We integrate with social media channels and popular online media outlets, constantly monitoring market sentiment in real-time.  Fundamental Analysis- All of our models are strictly driven by fundamental data. We do not believe historical price is predictive of future performance.  Network Clustering- Complex clustering algorithms and techniques are used to maintain a well-balanced and diversified portfolio at all times.

Author: JanuaryN
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Crown Sourced Sentiment Platform [Sect. 6 https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/sharpe-website/whitepaper.pdf]  The origins of crowd-sourced sentiment date back to the earliest days of hedge funds. The first hedge fund was created in 1949 by A. W. Jones, whose contributions to the field foreshadowed modern portfolio theory.  Jones suc- cessfully ’hedged’ his positions by taking long and short positions to insu- late his fund, and utilised leverage (borrowed capital) to increase his returns. Arguably  one  of  his  greatest  achievements,  however,  was  foreseeing  what cognitive  science  and  behavioural  psychology  would  only  come  to  under- stand half a century later:  that participant or traderemotionscreated trends in  asset  price  action.   Jones  argued  that  price  increases  generated  opti- mism (or confidence) in an asset, fuelling further price increases, resulting in  a  positive  feedback  loop  causing  an  asset’s  price  to  deviate  from  its  in- trinsic value, such that these trends could be identified from following price action.  Jones quickly realised that to determine the best long and short positions,  he  should  not  rely  on  chart  watching  alone,  but  should  source sentiment from those with a stake in market performance. Therefore, he cre- ated a system whereby he invited brokers to select their favourite long and short  positions,  simulating  running  live  portfolios  from  these  stock  picks. Jones utilised these predictions to select stocks and positions for his hedge fund, rewarding brokers in proportion to the value of the predictions they provided.   Through  this  method,  Jones  was  able  to  achieve  substantially improved returns on his investments.

Author: TheRedCanary
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Hello there, rather than comparing here is a brief description on Sharpe The Sharpe Capital Investment Platform brings together a multitude of novel innovations in smart contracts, quantitative trading, machine learning, linguistic analysis and artificial intelligence. SHP provides a proof-of-stake that permits platform participants to earn service fees in ETH in exchange for providing sentiment toward global equities and blockchain assets through our web and mobile platforms. Users are rewarded with service fees in proportion to the accuracy of the sentiment they provide, utilising a proof-of-reputation mechanism. The platform is active as an alpha version, you can sign up here, https://alpha.sharpe.capital/login  IF you wish to join the bounty you can do that here, https://t.me/sharpebounty

Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Remember there will be different revenue streams so it's not on percentage of fund returns. Te team is just building it out and scaling. Great project

Author: meditations1
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: To answer your question quite directly: Nothing guarantees the pool size  The pool is discretionary and will be announced each month. This is actually good because it means we will allocate a pool every month and absorb the risk in the business of months where the fund doesn't perform well, for example.  It's important to recognise that our tokens do not represent an interest in a fund, they are proof-of-stake tokens that underpin our entire ecosystem. Our fund is just the first of many that will pay SHP holders to access their predictions. As we increase the number of funds and institutions that are prepared to pay for this data, we expect the size of the payment pool to grow.

Author: Zoulman
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Hi, I have a simple question about the token. Is there a staking feature to access to the crowd santiment with the SHP tokens, like with CND or SAN ?  In the whitepaper, I see 2 things : - "Staking" is used to make prediction and necessary to be rewarded - API will be available if we buy the access with SHP tokens  So, do you plan an access to the API, by staking SHP tokens instead of buying this access ?  This model sounds more attractive instead of buying the access. (staking to have the right to work don't seem to be a feature, for example with CND you can make predictions without any token)

Author: meditations1
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: We aren’t crowdsourcing forecasts or analysis of any kind, and do not pay prizes. We’re measuring market sentiment and paying our community members in ETH, in proportion to their contribution.  We’re combining sentiment data with our own machine learning-driven investment strategies (and publicly recording our positions at Sharpe.fund), generating profit for community members while we develop blockchain asset analysis tools based on these strategies to assist institutional investors in understanding market movements in real-time.   API tools are in development and more information will be released later.

Author: weston4mills
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: I have a technical question: How does Sharpe capital utilize blockchain technology? As in where does it apply the technology? (Except for ownership of tokens)

Author: mexi.db
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: From the team on Telegram: "From a technical perspective, each users proof-of-work, stake, and reputation will be stored on the blockchain, maintaining an immutable record of their performance. ETH service fees are paid to our users using smart contracts.  We are also developing a trustless ledger to replace Sharpe.fund (this is ~80% complete), in which every position we take is recorded, encrypted, on the blockchain. When we close a position, the private key is automatically released by the trustless ledger service and the details of the position will be visible to all. This prevents a 'malicious actor' from manipulating our books, ensuring trust In Sharpe through trustless technology . Our Trustless Ledger Technology is also a product that we will offer to other funds, both in crypto, and as an auditing tool for hedge funds and institutional funds. There's a more technical description in our white paper and a description of the bad practices in recent history that led to catastrophes that our ledger would have prevented (For example, Nick Leeson manipulating the error account at Barings when he lost so much that the bank collapsed)" https://t.me/sharpecapital/11545

Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.

Author: N8Biz
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Yes the token will be tradable, however the exchanges have no been specified yet. Yes, the amount ETH reward a user receives is based on - the number of correct indications - their historical accuracy - the amount of work done - their proof-of-stake (as you mentioned), relative proportion of SHP held

Author: S3cco
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Bitcoin Garden: A Different Kind of Token Presale Underway https://bitcoingarden.org/different-kind-token-presale-underway/  A different kind of Ethereum-token presale is underway in the City of London. Sharpe Capital is selling a token called SHP that is based on a product that exists now and actually works.  Unlike some initial cryptocurrency offering (ICO) promoters that are selling only a concept, Sharpe has a platform that is scheduled to go live on 11 December 2017. Sharpe’s Financial Markets Protocol, which is designed to make trade decisions based on crowdsourced asset sentiment is already available for investors’ inspection online.  What is even more impressive is that Sharpe plans to reward SHP token holders that use the Sharpe Platform to offer opens the stock market and blockchain assets starting on 11 January, 2018. The reward will be in a widely used cryptocurrency, Ethereum (ETH), rather than Sharpe’s SHP token...

Author: Shahrul09
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Please do not pay attention to any links or adresses posted here regarding the presale! You will receive all the necessary information via email and on the official website! No one from the team will send you an adress or publish it here. Be safe!    Message from the Sharpe Team: Hi everyone - we are finalizing security checks across our infrastructure right now and will open the pre-sale very soon. Only those on the whitelist can contribute until Wednesday at 2pm GMT, and your registered contribution is guaranteed until then. We will contact those on the whitelist via e-mail once the pre-sale is live.  Please note: the ONE and ONLY place where you can obtain our contribution address is on our website after you have entered your personal details and confirmed your email address. Do not use ANY other address and trust nobody. If you have ANY doubts, please contact hello@sharpe.capital or reach out moderators in telegram.  https://t.me/sharpecapital

Author: baby222
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Any reason for sticking with Bancor? Seems like an overhead for so called liquidity reserve.

Author: hawkeyebc
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: The main reason is that the team is planning to use the Bancor protocol for continuous liquidity. This means you won't need a counterpart to trade your token since the Bancor smart contract already holds tokens in reserve. It allows any party to instantly purchase or liquidate the smart token in exchange for any of its tokens it holds in reserve. The price of that token is continuously calculated according to a formula which balances buy and sell volumes.  You can read more about this here: https://medium.com/@sharpecapital/sharpe-capital-and-the-bancor-protocol-6691c4be4cdd

Author: infested999
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: In the whitepaper item 2.1 the last sentence says Sharpe will sell data to hedge funds in return for Sharpe token. Does that mean they need to buy it in the market and give to Sharpe? What does Sharpe do with these tokens?

Author: hawkeyebc
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: The payment model as described uses SHP as an access fee for the cloud-based modelling infrastructure, not for the sale of data feeds, which is similar to the concept of gas in ETH. Access to this through SHP will come later than the data feed products. It's a complex framework to use and initially it will be focused on delivering value to sentiment participants by using it ourselves rather than developing it for hedge funds to use.  Data feeds will be sold in exchange fiat, as this is what funds are accustomed to, although we'll happily accept crypto when the market matures enough for hedge funds, etc., to use it.

Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: A better understand of sharoe I have found into Sharpe Capital group:  "SCD and SHP have fundamentally different purposes. SCD will simply be the first 'security token' Sharpe issues. SHP provides voting rights across the gamut of Sharpe's activities, including the creation of new tokenised funds or redistribution of capital within others — not mentioning the primary purpose of providing a proof-of-stake for earning Ether service fees in exchange for providing market insight. Indeed, as a security the value of SCD is a direct function of the performance of the underlying fund. SHP, however, provides an income stream of ETH with no potential loss of SHP (unlike prediction markets), simply for using the sentiment platform. SHP will also be of value to traders who wish to access the various components of our trading model, such as the AI portfolio manager."

Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: In terms of the relative value of each revenue stream, we will adapt to market forces and focus on whatever will drive greatest profit for Sharpe and the community of participants. Author: Shahrul09
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: You should read the blog They have explained it in there.  https://medium.com/@sharpecapital/reduced-hard-cap-and-other-updates-6e84e9f2d405  'This announcement follows discussions and meetings with a number of high-profile investors and advisors, particularly at last week’s d10e conference in Kyiv. While 2017 has seen some enormous raises through token launches, and we were optimistic of reaching our original $60MM target, the market landscape has undeniably changed. One of the many things that sets Sharpe apart from the rest is that when the community speaks, we listen, and we act. We’re fortunate enough to have the benefit of hindsight from many recent ICOs with extremely large caps, and while raising enormous sums of money, in the process this led to a saturation of demand during the crowd-sale period, and subsequently, a supply-demand deficit in secondary markets once tokens become tradable on exchanges. These problems will only be exacerbated when company tokens vest and enter circulation during an already bearish market.'

Author: dan_johns
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: I've read the whitepaper in it's entirety and am a big fan of the team. From what I've seen out there, nothing exists like this project. Here's why...  If you are comparing Sharpe Capital to projects like Numeraire (which there have been many comparisons); Sharpe is very different to Numerai for 2 reasons. Firstly, Sharpe will run their own proprietary quantitative models on a cloud-hosted architecture. Numerai is "crowdsourcing" models in an attempt to reduce overfitting, this probably wont work - what if all of the models are really overfitted?  Secondly, Sharpe offers an additional way to earn ETH, by providing forward-looking asset sentiment. Did you see the recent blog post with the Sharpe mobile app designs? By linking the sentiment to proof-of-stake and reputation, they are basically able to ensure they are sourcing the highest possible sentiment. Checkout section 6 of the whitepaper for more detail on this.  The sentiment gives Sharpe other revenue streams, such as selling data feeds to hedge funds, something I'm not aware Numeraire are doing. Quantitative modelling alone is not good enough to predict future stock prices, without a way to accurately measure investor sentiment. Taking into account investor sentiment essentially solves the problem.  A few other noteworthy competitors to mention: (1) Santiment; (2) Xinfin. In regards to Santiment, some of their revenue streams are comparable to Sharpe's. Sharpe seeks to capture investor response to consumed media at a cognitive-behavioural level, as opposed to merely infer 'posifive' and 'negative' sentiment from that media. In reference to Xinfin, they are offering an enterprise grade private Blockchains. Sharpe plans to offer this too, only it's being built on top of the Trustless Ledger System (one of the golden nuggets in this project), to offer blockchain based internal auditing/transactional solutions.  Also, make sure to check out a recent article they posted: https://medium.com/@sharpecapital/sharpe-capitals-place-in-the-fintech-space-b220770a04fd

Author: lewisbarber
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Hey, that's right in reference to SCD. SCD is not the token that we're issuing in November, SCD will be made available at a later date to SHP holders, once we receive regulatory approval to issue it.  SHP is a utility token which provides access to our crowdsourced sentiment platform (see the mobile app here: https://medium.com/@sharpecapital/sharpe-platform-ui-core-concept-designs-6aeb8da7a333). The dividends for SCD will be issued regardless of whether users participate, whereas SHP rewards require participation in the sentiment platform to earn Ether!  Thanks!  Lewis

Author: lewisbarber
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: When SCD is initially issued the dividend pool will be 20%. It's important to be clear that SCD will not be a right, but rather something we issue to those that meet the necessary compliance requirements, since it will effectively be a crypto-security...  The reward pool for SHP tokens & sentiment participators, will be variable between 0-20%, depending on the other factors that contribute to the reward formula.  If you want more information about sentiment rewards I would refer you to section 6 of the whitepaper.  Thanks!

Author: lewisbarber
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Hey! Have you seen the roadmap on our website?  https://sharpe.capital/roadmap  2018 - Q1  LONDON OFFICE We will open our HQ in London, which will form the basis of our expansion as we start growing the business.  2018 - Q2  GROWING THE TEAM The team will include dedicated roles for; DevOps, Marketing, Operations, Testing & Security. We will offer equity options to everyone joining at this stage.  2018 - Q3  ALPHA PLATFORM Our Alpha platform will be available to an exclusive set of customers and community members, who will help us refine our product before we move to mass-market adoption.  2018 - Q4  SHARPE HACKATHON Sharpe will host a 48 hour Hackathon, where attendees will build, test and deploy investment models on our Alpha platform.   2019 - Q1  SCD ISSUANCE Subject to obtaining regulatory sign-off, we will allow SHP holders to claim SCD at a rate of 1-to-1.  2019 - Q2  PLATFORM LAUNCH & LIVE TRADING Sharpe will start live implementation of our proprietary investment models, designed & implemented in-house and verified during the Alpha phase with small sums of capital.  2019 - Q3  1ST SCD DIVIDENDS The 1st rewards will be paid to SCD holders six months after our platform launch.  2019 - Q4  HEDGE FUND PARTNERSHIPS We will form strategic partnerships with up-to five hedge funds, who will receive favourable execution fees in exchange for providing liquidity to the Sharpe investment platform.   Also you should checkout the mobile app we're working on:  https://medium.com/@sharpecapital/sharpe-platform-ui-core-concept-designs-6aeb8da7a333

Author: RitzBitzz
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: This is a good short description than the 60 pages wp, qould be better to have a simple viral video also    Sharpe Capital is a multifaceted investment company that integrates several proprietary strategies to trade on government regulated stock exchanges. Its initial index fund will be using a long/short strategy by buying long assets while simultaneously short selling those that are expected decrease in value. It will do this through their Quantitative Trading Model which utilizes several proprietary market assessment strategies.

Author: dan_johns
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: The ground-breaking protocol for providing liquidity to tokens on the Ethereum blockchain provided by Bancor is shaping the future of new altcoins.  Sharpe Capital is one of the first who will embrace the Bancor protocol, which means that the market participants will always be able to liquidate or purchase Sharpe’s SHP tokens without having to find a counterparty to buy or sell the tokens.   Sharpe Capital is an innovative blockchain startup, crowdsourcing the world’s best asset sentiment via the Ethereum blockchain. Users of the Sharpe Platform earn Ether rewards in exchange for their opinions about global equity markets.   With its upcoming token sale, Sharpe Capital will expand operations and allow consumer investors, hedge funds and institutional investors to profit from a best in class investment fund, while maintaining high levels of trust via a decentralised ‘trustless’ immutable trade ledger.  To learn more about the project and meet the team, visit the Sharpe Capital Telegram Channel: https://t.me/sharpecapital

Author: JamesAButler
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Hey, thanks for your question. So, contextual frame analysis (CFA), is one of the more hypothetical elements of the platform. It is not necessary for its operation, but we believe it would serve to further reduce risk and increase returns by improving accuracy as compared to the more standard sentiment analysis approaches - of which there are many.  In the simplest terms, CFA is an attempt to capture how language use (contextual frames) drives decision making. The seminal example given is the 'Virus vs Beast' study by Thibodeau and Boroditsky (2011), in which an identical article about a crime wave - except a one word difference - is shown to two groups of people. One article used the word 'beast' and the other used 'virus'. The consensus of the group that saw 'beast' was that punitive action should be taken against the criminals, however, the group that saw 'virus' leaned strongly toward rehabilitation. When the people in these groups were asked to justify their decision, nobody mentioned the virus/beast word usage, and quoted data/statistics from the article.  (See pp. 28-29 in our white paper)  That is, people came to opposing decisions while justifying them with the same data, driven by the contextual frame in which they saw the data. We are working with Mieke, a linguistic & expert in frame analysis, to develop a strategy that enables us to determine whether these 'contextual frames' are more likely to drive an investor toward 'bullish' or 'long' vs 'bearish' or 'short' when consuming news media and other data sources from which they make their investment decision. Underpinning this theory is the concept that decision making is, to a significant extent, emotional - even when investors insist their actions are data driven, they are ultimately slaves to the cognitive decision making processes we all evolved with.  At the moment we are developing a manual CFA process based on 'traditional' linguistic frame analysis as a proof-of-concept on a relatively small number of news articles, as this is a novel idea in both investment and linguistics. Once the relationship between frames and responses is established in a few key examples, we will quickly scale it to operate on a large scale using natural language processing techniques within artificial intelligence and machine learning, such that our algorithms can learn to optimally identify contextual frames based on historical data. We aim to have this operational along with the rest of the platform - however, this is a scientific endeavour, and as such may be subject to further development before we release it in the wild.  It is probably the most exciting of the linguistic analysis approaches we're taking, but it is not mission critical to operation of the fund - it will simply serve to enhance it.  Let me know if you have any more questions. If you're interested in the linguistics side of things, Mieke hangs out in the Telegram group.  James

Author: lewisbarber
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Hello niknik,  We've contacted a number of major exchanges. Most of whom have said they will keep an eye on our crowdsale, and make a decision once they are able to gauge demand for the token. We have recently launched our pre-sale registration form, which is helping us gauge demand before the sale actually opens, and also gives those who wish to contribute to the pre-sale some piece of mind that their contribution is guaranteed (https://sharpe.capital/tokens#pre-sale).  A key part of our strategy, though, is also to provide intrinsic liquidity via the Bancor protocol. We have committed to allocating any funds raised over $45m USD to Bancor/liquidity reserves for SHP tokens.  Finally, we're open to considering other decentralised exchanges (e.g. 0x), however this is not part of our main strategy at this stage, as liquidity on these exchanges is typically not as good as it would be via Bancor/an actual exchange.  Thanks,  Lewis

Author: thehun
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Users provide their sentiment with respect to certain stocks (bullish/bearish) and they get rewarded in function of the accuracy of their predictions and the amount of SHP tokens held. There will be a reputation score system that will constantly update itself as the user provides sentiment feedback.  For a more in-depth explanation and an example refer to page 34 of the White Paper:    In equation 1, Rcurrent is the users current reputation score, calculated weekly based on how accurate the provided sentiment was. R is linearly modulated by a scalar constant, m (equation 2) positively for each correct prediction and negatively for each incorrect prediction. That is, for each correct prediction the reputation score is increased or decreased by multiplying the user’s previous reputation score, Rprevious, by m, and adding this to Rcurrent. This is repeated for incorrect predictions, but by reducing R by R · m instead of increasing it. The maximum value of R is 1, and the minimum value is 0, as stated in equation 3.  The impact of predictions on a user’s reputation score is perhaps best demonstrated by example (let us assume that m = 0.05):  • A user has R = 0.5, and provides 6 correct and 3 incorrect predictions. Their new R is (0.5 + (6 ∗ 0.5 ∗ 0.05)) − (3 ∗ 0.5 ∗ 0.05) = 0.575. This represents an increase of 7.5 percentage points for all rewards received by this user for correct predictions. • A user has R = 0.2, and provides 6 correct and 3 incorrect predictions. Their new R is (0.2 + (6 ∗ 0.2 ∗ 0.05)) − (3 ∗ 0.2 ∗ 0.05) = 0.23. This represents an increase of 3 percentage points for all rewards received by this user for correct predictions. • A user has R = 0.5, and provides 3 correct and 6 incorrect predictions. Their new R is (0.5 + (3 ∗ 0.5 ∗ 0.05)) − (6 ∗ 0.5 ∗ 0.05) = 0.425. This represents a decrease of 7.5 percentage points for all rewards received by this user for correct predictions. • A user has R = 0.2, and provides 3 correct and 6 incorrect predictions. Their new R is (0.2 + (6 ∗ 0.2 ∗ 0.05)) − (3 ∗ 0.2 ∗ 0.05) = 0.17. This represents a decrease of 3 percentage points for all rewards received by this user for correct predictions.  As the example above illustrates, changes in a user’s R are linear - that is, the relative change in R is dependent only on the accuracy of the user’s provided sentiment, and not the previous value of R.

Author: lewisbarber
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Quantitative modelling alone only produces mediocre predictive capabilities, because markets are fundamentally driven by two factors:  1) the tendency of an asset to return to its "intrinsic" value 2) irrational investor sentiment, driving an asset away from its intrinsic value  We have married these two approaches together to create a unique investment algorithm that is capable of consistently beating the market, and incentivises our token holders to provide the high-quality sentiment that we need to satisfy point 2 above. By paying rewards to holders of our tokens (SHP), linked to proof-of-stake, proof-of-work and proof-of-reputation, we ensure we capture the highest quality sentiment possible, and fairly reward those that help our fund generate better returns, with bi-annual Ether payments.  I would encourage you to read section 6 of the white paper, which describes the dynamics of crowdsourcing sentiment in great detail. The ultimate premise can be broken down into two points:  1) when there is something at stake, people will work harder to improve the sentiment they provide 2) when this information is provided by "the crowd", the quality & accuracy will far exceed that of any individual  Perhaps the most novel element of our crowdsourced sentiment analysis is the fact that, unlike prediction markets, there are no odds and you can never lose the SHP you have staked. Because the "reputation score" is calculated on a rolling basis, bad sentiment only serves to reduce any future rewards that sentiment providers may earn. Of course a low reputation score can be improved by providing more good sentiment in the future.  We appreciate our concepts aren't the easiest to grasp, but I heard a wise man once said: the hardest things to understand are usually the best

Author: dan_johns
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Patterns observed in 'technical analysis' are generally unreliable due to a large degree of stochasticity. There is no evidence to suggest that technicalism out-performs the market, on average. There are undeniably historical patterns to some extent, despite the well-known observation that future performance cannot be predicted by historical prices. These patterns emerge as a result of the collective cognitive behavioural processes of traders. We go beyond looking at simple positive and negative sentiment, by not only crowd-sourcing actual opinions from those with a proof-of-stake (instead of merely attempting to infer using Natural Language Processing), and we are combining this analysis of social and 'old' media to infer predicted 'investor responses' to the media they consume.  To quote the white paper: "Investor sentiment, whether rational or irrational, causes an asset’s market trading value to deviate from its ’intrinsic’ value as determined by fundamentalist microeconomic indicators. That is, trading is fundamentally driven by human decision-making based on individual traders’ beliefs, perception and confidence levels." - It is this process responsible for technicalism, and therefore we incorporate these processes at a far more fundamental level.

Author: MrAtom
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: What is the cap for this sale?

Author: lewisbarber
Title: [ENDED][SHP] Sharpe Capital - Sentiment & Financial Protocol.
Body: Hi MrAtom!  We're implementing a $10m USD hard-cap for the pre-sale, with the crowdsale hard-cap being undisclosed. The reason for this is that we're implementing "dynamic ceilings" during the live-sale, as pioneered by Status, to ensure an even distribution of SHP ownership and to make sure our governance and voting mechanism is not compromised by a concentration of SHP tokens in a few hands.  Therefore, we're advising larger contributors to join in the pre-sale, of which the first hour will be uncapped. We can tell you that the hard-cap of the crowdsale, and therefore maximum market-cap, will be between $60m and 90m USD.  We have committed to using anything raised above $45m USD for token liquidity. SHP tokens will be backed by the Bancor protocol, and we will calculate the exact reserve once we know how much we've raised. If there are excess funds above $45m USD and the Bancor reserve, we will reserve these to be used for additional liquidity in the future, as required.  Thanks,  Lewis
